title: Ticket #3327: SLOT_TYPE cpus=auto produces wrong number of Cpus
description:
Base config - 

SLOT_TYPE_1_PARTITIONABLE = TRUE
NUM_SLOTS_TYPE_1 = 1

With SLOT_TYPE_1 = auto 

$ condor_status -long
TotalCpus = 4
Cpus = 1
TotalSlotCpus = 1
DetectedCpus = 4
...

With SLOT_TYPE_1 = cpus=auto,auto 

$ condor_status -long
TotalCpus = 4
Cpus = 1
TotalSlotCpus = 1
DetectedCpus = 4
...

With SLOT_TYPE_1 = cpus=100%,auto 

$ condor_status -long
TotalCpus = 4
Cpus = 4
TotalSlotCpus = 4
DetectedCpus = 4
...

The in all cases TotalCpus == Cpus is correct. This is how Memory and Disk work (roughly: Disk appears to be evaluated at different times and has slightly different values).

Problem: The partitionable slot will have Cpus = 0 after one job start running, thus preventing the use of the remaining cores.
